attributes.descriptionHtml: Shyann and Shiloh were turned in to us by their owners after having a litter of kittens they could not find homes for. Shyann is the quieter of the two sisters but is a sweet little girl that loves to be loved :)
attributes.descriptionText: Shyann and Shiloh were turned in to us by their owners after having a litter of kittens they could not find homes for.  Shyann is the quieter of the two sisters but is a sweet little girl that loves to be loved :)
attributes.name: Shyann

attributes.breedString: Tiger / Domestic Short Hair / Mixed (short coat)
attributes.descriptionHtml:
Hi there from brothers Sam and Bobby! Sam here - I am the handsome orange guy; my brother, Bobby, isn't bad looking, either, with those cool tiger stripes and that come hither look.  We are pretty laid back and are currently interviewing humans for our next home. (We would really prefer not to be near noisy machines here like the "washing machine", whatever THAT is.) We just turned 3-years-old in May - Happy Birthday to us! The best gift would be to have a place we can call home. We think we're kind of perfect. We haven't been with other cats or dogs so we'd probably have to figure that out together. In this great country, everyone should have a cat - or two!

If you're interested in Sam and Bobby, stop by the shelter during our adoption hours: Tuesdays & Thursdays from 6-8pm and Saturdays from 10am-4pm or email our Feline Manager at felinemanager@quincyanimalshelter.org

attributes.descriptionHtml: Chrissy is a sweet little girl who loves to be held. She would love a home to call her own. Chrissy is litter box trained, UTD on shots and her $40.00 adoption fee includes a voucher to have her spayed when she reaches 4 months. She would adjust quickly to other pets due to her young age.

attributes.name: Chrissy

attributes.descriptionHtml: Janet can be shy when she first meets someone but warms up quickly. This baby needs a home in order to feel safe and secure. She is litter box trained, UTD on shots and her $40.00 adoption fee includes a voucher to have her spayed when she reaches 4 months. She would adjust quickly to other pets due to her young age.

attributes.descriptionHtml: Jack is a loving guy who is searching for his forever home. He loves everyone he meets but does take a few minutes to be sure about that. He is litter box trained, UTD on shots and his $40.00 adoption fee includes a voucher to have him neutered when he reaches 4 months. Jack would adjust quickly to other pets due to her young age.

attributes.descriptionHtml:
Dixie was surrendered to our shelter due to not fault of her own. She is a very cute, sweet little girl who loves to play. She would really love a home with a fur sibling to grow up with. She is UTD on shots, spayed, house trained and very eager to please.

 

The H.A.S. $40.00 adoption fee includes a spay/neuter voucher, if the animal is unaltered. This voucher can be redeemed at the shelter vet in Hernando.
attributes.name: Dixie

attributes.descriptionHtml:
You can call me casanova because I am a LOVER! I love to give kisses and snuggle nice and close. I love dinnertime.  I play very well with other dogs. I would love to be a part of your family!

Bernie is 9 months old- a bulldog/ beagle mix. UTD on vaccinations and neutered- His adoption fee is $250.00.

Name: Beabull
Mix: 1/2 Beagle x 1/2 Bulldog
Mixes: More Beagle Mixes , More Bulldog Mixes






Appearance: Beabulls have the Bulldog wrinkles and underbite.


Characteristics: Beabulls are amazing jumpers.


Personality: Beabulls are extremely friendly and always willing to give kisses and cuddle.


Temperament: Beabulls are loveable, even-tempered, easy going, non-aggressive dogs. Beabulls can be very hyper while they are playing.


Family Dog: Beabulls make good family dogs. They love little children and don't seem to mind when they cry or scream. Small children should be supervised when playing with a Beabull. Beabulls are mellow dogs, but get excited while playing and may lightly play-bite.


Ears: The ears of a Beabull are not quite as big as a full blooded beagle, but have the same style.


Muzzle: Beabulls have very strong jaws.


Body: Beabulls have a very strong, sleak body like a Beagle with hips like a Bulldog.


Feet: Beabulls have feet similiar to a bulldog.


Tail: The Beabulls tail may be docked.


Color: Beabulls have a mixture of Beagle and Bulldog coloring.





Coat: Beabulls have a softer coat on her sides with coarse, prickly coat on the top of their back.


Shedding: Beabulls shed a lot.


Training: Beabulls respond fairly well to commands and are very easy to potty train.


Behavior: Beabulls love to play like a Beagle but have sluggish Bulldog moments. Beabulls love to cuddle and be close to people. Beabulls are vigorous chewers and can destroy their toys. Beabulls have the beagle obsession with sniffing things.


Barking: Beabulls bark occasionally, especially when people come to the door.


Weather: Beabulls love to spend time outside in the summer and warm weather. In the winter they may enjoy a romp in the snow and chasing snowballs.


Exercise: Beabulls can be pretty lazy, but do love to chew and play tug-o-war.


Physical Ability: Beabulls are amazing jumpers.

attributes.descriptionHtml:
Bob is a sweet one year old lab mix. He's a gentleman dog who is housetrained, UTD on shots and he's learning to walk on a leash. Bob would love a home with a fenced in yard where he could run and play.

 

The H.A.S. adoption includes a spay/neuter voucher, if the animal is unaltered. This voucher can be redeemed at the shelter vet in Hernando.
attributes.name: Bob

attributes.descriptionHtml:
I am a playful little guy that LOVES toys! I'll carry sticks around, chase a ball and play tug of war. I love playing with other dogs, especially my brother Bernie. I can be very cuddly when I'm tired and promise to listen very well to you. I'd be great in any home, especially a home with other pets (cats too) or kids.
Buck is 3 months old- a bulldog/ beagle mix. UTD on vaccinations and neutered- His adoption fee is $250.00. They are working on housetraining and are doing good!

attributes.descriptionHtml:
Morris is a loving guy that wants a forever home. He will rub against you to get your attention and give head butts. Morris is a laid back guy that gets along with dogs and cats. He'd be a great addition to any household. We think the family that adopts him with be very lucky to have him.

 

The H.A.S. $40.00 adoption fee includes a spay/neuter voucher, if the animal is unaltered. This voucher can be redeemed at the shelter vet in Hernando.
attributes.name: Morris

attributes.descriptionHtml:
Adoption Pending 

Filling out an  application from our web site at www.caninecastaways.org  is the first step in adopting a new furry family member.

NAME:   Tippy
BREED:  Shih Tzu/Dachshund mix
SEX:  female
COLOR:  brown/tan/white
AGE:  Born March 1, 2016
WEIGHT:  5 lbs as of May 9, 2016

 

FOSTERED BY:   Timea
LOCATED IN:  Sarasota


NOTES FROM FOSTER FAMILY:

Tippy and her brother Tony are puppies that were born in our care.  After we rescued their mother Annie (who is a Shih Tzu) we realized she was far along in a pregnancy and going to be giving birth soon.  They are the only 2 from the litter and love each other.  They would love to get a home together but could be separated as long as they go to homes that have at least one other dog that is going to play with them and allow them to be "puppies" and jump, play, etc. with them.

They are working on potty training and getting used to normal "life" noises.  They are both very sweet and happy.

Local adoptions only - Manatee, Sarasota, Charlotte, Lee, Collier counties.  These puppies will need to be brought back to our vet in Arcadia for follow up vaccines as well as spay/neuter surgery when they are old enough.  

If you are interested in adopting please Complete our Adoption Application by copying and pasting the following link into your web browser: http://www.caninecastaways.org/#!adopt/c6mv


MEDICAL INFO:


The following has been or will be done for this puppy at the appropriate age...
- Basic Exam by Veterinarian
- Spayed or Neutered
- Placed on heartworm preventive
- Basic Bloodwork
- Microchipped
- Intestinal Parasite Exam and medication
- Vaccinations
- Placed on flea preventive


ADOPTION DONATION: $300


This adoption donation helps to cover the vet expenses for this puppy including heartworm preventive which is dispensed at the initial vet visit and then goes with the dog at adoption. All vet records will be provided to adopter.

Visit us at www.caninecastaways.org

attributes.breedString: Fox Terrier / Australian Cattle Dog/Blue Heeler / Mixed
attributes.descriptionHtml:
RESCUED FROM A HIGH KILL SHELTER, NOW IN NEED OF A HOME!

COCO is a VERY CUTE, adorable 9 month old, 25 lb, chocolate terrier mix pup who was saved from a high kill shelter, where she and her litter mates had been turned in. She is a wonderful 'cinnamony' color, with unique grey hair effects on her back above the below chocolate coloring. A docile, gentle, playful, sweet, fun loving girl, who is eager to please and responds terrifically to praise and kindness. Coco loves to give kisses! Coco gets along terrifically with other dogs, even large ones. Coco is spayed, current on vaccinations, house-trained and crate-trained. Contact: 215-450-8335
Coco is presently residing in the Rootstown Ohio area.

Coco is not a Rose's Rescue dog. Please contact Coco's caregiver at 215-450-8335.

attributes.descriptionHtml: Shiloh and Shyann were turned in to us by their owners when they had a litter of kittens they could not find homes for. Shiloh is the more outgoing of the two and is very energetic.
attributes.descriptionText: Shiloh and Shyann were turned in to us by their owners when they had a litter of kittens they could not find homes for.  Shiloh is the more outgoing of the two and is very energetic.
attributes.name: Shiloh

attributes.descriptionHtml:
2016/05/22

Danny has been a very popular dog and we are no longer accepting applications. Please consider another of our deserving dogs!

Adoption Fee Applies

Name/Tag#: Danny 3354

Age: 1.5 years

Sex/Altered: Male/ Neutered

Weight: 16lbs

Breed: Schnauzer

Foster Home Location: OSHAWA, ON

Adoption Fee: $500.00

Temperament: Loving, friendly, slightly nervous

Activity/Energy Level: Medium, loves to chase a ball

Up to date on Shots: Yes

Housebroken: Yes

Crate Trained: Yes

Ok with Dogs: Yes

Ok with Cats: Unknown

Ok with Kids: Yes, over 8 years old please

Origin: Owner surrender

Requirements: Securely fenced yard, someone home most of the day, experienced dog owner, detached home


And now, a few words from me:

Hi, my name is Danny and I'm looking for a forever home. I'm staying in my foster home but don't know how long I will be here - perhaps you could tell me? My foster mom and dad say they don't expect me to be here long as they think I am a good boy who will be a popular dog. I hope so, even though it is fun here. I have a dog friend to play with and we have become great
friends.

And now, a few words from my foster mom:

Danny is a lovely boy. Although he is only 1.5 years old, he can be a calm dog to have around but he does get anxious if he thinks you are leaving the house. He has brought new life into our 9 year old dog who has been playing with him ever since he got here and I think he has exhausted poor Danny. Danny eats well, is house trained, sleeps in his crate and only gets up when
you get up, is well mannered and knows lie, sit and stay. He 'bongs" around the yard as he jumps when he runs - so cute to watch. Danny might do well in agility classes. As he is still a puppy, he is mouthy when playing with you but he does this
gently. He takes treats gently, patiently waiting his turn. He likes squeaky toys and will drop a toy at your feet to say "come and play".

He goes into the yard to do his business but likes to come right back in unless you stay with him, however, knowing 'stay' he is increasing his time left outside. Someone around in the day would be good. He barks when someone comes to the door so not good for an apartment. We like having Danny around but not sure he will he be here that long? What do you think?
Fill in an application to see what a great companion he is.
attributes.descriptionText:
2016/05/22

Danny has been a very popular dog and we are no longer accepting applications. Please consider another of our deserving dogs!

Adoption Fee Applies

Name/Tag#: Danny 3354


Age: 1.5 years

Sex/Altered: Male/ Neutered

Weight: 16lbs

Breed: Schnauzer

Foster Home Location: OSHAWA, ON

Adoption Fee: $500.00

Temperament: Loving, friendly, slightly nervous

Activity/Energy Level: Medium, loves to chase a ball

Up to date on Shots: Yes

Housebroken: Yes

Crate Trained: Yes

Ok with Dogs: Yes

Ok with Cats: Unknown

Ok with Kids: Yes, over 8 years old please

Origin: Owner surrender

Requirements: Securely fenced yard, someone home most of the day, experienced dog owner, detached home


And now, a few words from me:

Hi, my name is Danny and I'm looking for a forever home. I'm staying in my foster home but don't know how long I will be here - perhaps you could tell me? My foster mom and dad say they don't expect me to be here long as they think I am a good boy who will be a popular dog. I hope so, even though it is fun here. I have a dog friend to play with and we have become great
friends.

And now, a few words from my foster mom:

Danny is a lovely boy. Although he is only 1.5 years old, he can be a calm dog to have around but he does get anxious if he thinks you are leaving the house. He has brought new life into our 9 year old dog who has been playing with him ever since he got here and I think he has exhausted poor Danny. Danny eats well, is house trained, sleeps in his crate and only gets up when
you get up, is well mannered and knows lie, sit and stay. He 'bongs" around the yard as he jumps when he runs - so cute to watch. Danny might do well in agility classes. As he is still a puppy, he is mouthy when playing with you but he does this
gently. He takes treats gently, patiently waiting his turn. He likes squeaky toys and will drop a toy at your feet to say "come and play".

He goes into the yard to do his business but likes to come right back in unless you stay with him, however, knowing 'stay' he is increasing his time left outside. Someone around in the day would be good. He barks when someone comes to the door so not good for an apartment. We like having Danny around but not sure he will he be here that long? What do you think?
Fill in an application to see what a great companion he is.

attributes.name: Quincy Animal Shelter
attributes.adoptionProcess:
Process:  1- interview with adoption representative and animal. 2- two personal references, veterinarian reference, proof of home ownership (if applicable) or landlord approval 3- the adopted animal will go home with age appropriate shots, spay/neuter (if age appropriate) or free spay/neuter certificate for our veterinarian.   

The adoption fee for dogs starts at $250, depending on age, breed. and medical history of the dog. The adoption fee for cats starts at $150 depending on age, breed, and medical history. Kittens start at $175.
attributes.about:
The Quincy Animal Shelter is a 100% volunteer-run organization. The Shelter relies completely on our volunteers and the community for support. Incorporated in November 1999 as a non-profit Massachusetts charity, we are also a recognized charity under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Service code. Since 1999 the Quincy Animal Shelter has placed more than 7,500 cats and dogs into loving and forever homes throughout MA and New England.

As a "no kill" shelter, we make every effort to find the right home for every animal in our care. Every animal receives age-appropriate vaccinations, micro-chipped, and is spayed or neutered before finding its forever family. 

Delivering this type of care involves many volunteers, an active and dedicated management and Board, and a lot of money. Our budget runs approximately $250,000 every year in order to keep doing what we do to help the dogs and cats of Quincy. 

Please visit our Volunteer and Wish List pages to find out about ways you can help. Our capacity at the Shelter is limited to a maximum of 12 dogs and 15 to 25 cats, depending on ages and condition of the cats. Our dream is to eventually have a larger facility so that we can continue our mission on a larger scale and serve the continuous needs of the community and the animals.
attributes.services: Cat/dog adoption, TNR of feral cats for Quincy residents.

attributes.name: Hernando Animal Shelter
attributes.about: We are an animal shelter that supports the City of Hernando by taking in stray animals and enforcing the state and city ordinances. Our goal is to enrich the lives of the citizens of Hernando and to help the homeless pets of our city.

attributes.name: A New Leash on Life Rescue
Black with Brown, Red, Golden, Orange or Chestnut
Rose's Rescue
attributes.adoptionProcess:
The first step to adopting is to fill out the Online Adoption Application  at www.rosesrescue.net. After your application has been reviewed and approved, one of our volunteers will get in touch with you. As long as your application has been pre-approved, the pet's foster parent will set up a time with you to come visit the pet you're interested in. In some cases, a home visit may also be required. If all goes well, you will then sign an adoption contract, pay the adoption fee, and then your new pet is ready to go to its forever home!

Dogs
Adoption Fees:
Mixed Breed: $125
Prison Trained Dogs: $145
Purebred: $150 no papers $165 w/papers

All dogs will be current on shots (EXCEPT Rabies), and be spayed or neutered (if not of age they will come with a certificate to be done within 14 days after coming of age).

Cats
Adoption Fees:
The adoption fee for cats is $75.

Cats are spayed or neutered (or come with the certificate)and UTD on shots (except for Rabies) and are aids and Leukemia tested.
attributes.about:
A small group of volunteers..no paid employees. Our dogs are in area foster homes or they are housed at Rose's..in a heated pole building with a "bedroom" (toddler beds, a chair and a radio..so they can keep up on current events) with a dog door to a small fenced area to potty in through out the day and night. Then they get to play in a four acre fenced in area and swim in the pond every day too! We do not have a "shelter" per se and only under special circumstances are any of our animals "kenneled". They are very well socialized with people and other animals, which makes it much easier to know their temperaments. We do NOT take owner surrenders. But we will do courtesy posts for pets that are vetted and in need of homes. OUR MISSION STATEMENT Rose's Rescue is an all breed rescue for dogs and cats. We primarily concentrate on local pound rescues as we feel these are the animals in the most dire need of a second chance. We are committed to finding the best possible home for each, and every animal that comes into our rescue and we are available to help with any training or behavioral issues for the life of each animal. Rose's Rescue requires that any animal adopted through our organization be returned to us if for any reason the family is no longer able to care for them. Rose's Rescue is also committed to educating the public on the importance of spay and neuter, routine vaccinations, heartworm protection for dogs, and aids and leukemia testing for cats. According to the Humane Society of American over 4 million dogs, cats, kittens and puppies are killed each year. It is our goal to some day see no adoptable pets euthanized.
Every two months, Rose’s Rescue chooses a few special candidates for a new class of dogs to be trained at the Trumbull Correctional Institution near Warren, Ohio.  While enrolled in this program, each dog will be trained by selected inmates and overseen by professional dog trainer Bill Oliver (www.customcaninecompany.com) who generously volunteers his time with this laudable project.  Upon completion of their training, cell dogs will have learned important socialization skills, have mastered basic obedience commands, and be fully housebroken.  They will also be taught tricks to entertain their future families and friends, such as sitting pretty, playing dead, and give a high five.  All dogs can be visited (by appointment and accompanied by a Rose’s Rescue representative) while at the prison.  They can be adopted upon graduation, or occasionally sooner if a dog has done exceptionally well and is deemed ready to leave before the class is actually finished.  All of our current cell dogs or graduates are designated as such in their individual descriptions in the “Our Adoptables” section of this website.  If you’d like to get a jump-start on training your new pet, consider adopting a Rose’s Rescue cell dog!

attributes.name: Paws For Seniors
attributes.adoptionProcess:
Adoption Process
Potential adopters must follow our adoption process begins with an adoption application, an interview, reference check and a home visit.  Adoption Applications may be submitted in advance for pre-approval and will be kept on file.
Before completing the adoption application, you should consider the following:
●
Lifestyle (house, apartment, single, busy schedule, etc.)
●
Preference of male or female dog or cat
●
Desired personality and energy level (playfulness, calm, dominant, needy, etc.)
●
Appropriate age of the pet for your family.
●
Age of any children you may have. Ordinarily our pets are not suitable for homes with children under 5.
 The Process:
1.
Submit an application. Please allow 1 week for your application to be reviewed.
2.
Adoption Applications may be submitted for pre-approval and will be kept on file.
3.
Initial interview by phone or email will be made within one week after receipt of your application.
4.
We will then check references; if approved  we will schedule a home visit, the final step in approving your application. All members of your family must be present.
5.
After home inspection and upon approval, an Adoption Contract will be processed, which includes a two week (14 days) trial period. At this time, the adoption fee will be collected and the trial period will begin. The trial period will allow you to decide if the pet is a good match for you and your family. 
6.
During the two week trial, if you decide that the pet is not a good match, the pet will be returned to Paws for Seniors and the Adoption fee will be refunded. 
7.
Adoptions fees: Senior Dogs $150.00 Senior Cats $120.00
A Successful Applicant Must:
●
Provide a loving, humane and safe environment for the Paws for Seniors pet, which includes keeping the dog as an indoor house pet for the remainder of his/her life.
●
Provide veterinary care and pet meds, including regular vaccinations, heart worm testing and preventative year round, and comply with all local laws regarding licensing.
●
Provide a safe, fenced in yard while the Paws for Seniors dog is outside supervised by you or a family member.
●
Agree to keep the Paws for Seniors dog on a leash when outside a fenced area and not allow him/her to roam free at any time.
●
Consider all lifestyle changes that can affect your life and your pet: Are your energy levels likely to change soon because of ongoing health issues? If something happens to you, what happens to your pets?
●
Return the Paws for Seniors pet at any time if the owner is unable to keep him/her for any reason or if lifestyle changes make the owner unable to maintain above conditions.
attributes.about:
Paws for Seniors is an all volunteer rescue group in Fauquier County, VA.
Dedicated to caring for and finding homes for senior dogs and cats, aged seven years and older where they can live out their golden years with dignity and love through rescue, foster, adoption, and hospice.

The Problem
For any number of reasons senior dogs and cats are given up by, in many cases, the only family they have ever known.  More often then not, they end up in animal shelters.
Our Philosophy & Goals
We  believe that senior  dogs and cats   deserve a safe and caring environment in which to live out their golden years. We formed, Paws For Seniors, to help find these homeless pets a home where they can live out their remaining days with love and dignity.
We do not believe that we are in competition with rescue groups and shelters but in concert.  We all have the same goal of helping animals in distress, caring for them, and finding furever homes.   
We believe that pet companionship is key to keeping our aging society young at heart! We will work to match senior dogs & cats with senior citizens, while considering the needs of  both.
We will work with rescues/shelters to network and cross-post Senior Dogs and Cats in their care to aid in finding a permanent home.
We will establish a network of foster homes, including Senior Citizens to provide a safe and caring environment for pets in need while waiting for their forever homes.  This would be a win-win situation for seniors that would love a pet but cannot afford the expense.  The foster home provides the love and daily care to a Senior Dog or Cat in need. Paws For Seniors provides the food, pet meds and vet care while looking for a forever home.  In some cases our Foster Home providers may become permanent fosters.
We will establish a program to aid Senior Citizens to keep the companionship of the pets they currently have.
We will work to bring awareness and educate the public on humane animal welfare issues.

attributes.name: Rockwall Pets
attributes.adoptionProcess: We ask a minimum $175 donation for dogs and $50 for cats. Puppies are $225 and kittens are $125. Senior dogs have a special rate of $100. All pets have their basic vaccinations, have been spayed/neutered and microchipped. An adoption counselor interviews the potential adopting family, then has them complete the application.
attributes.about: We are a foster based organization with no shelter facility. We helped the Rockwall shelter become no kill and we are now proud to say that we take in more dogs and cats from Dallas Animal Services than any other organization. Our fosters are passionate about saving lives. We have a robust transport program and we drive dogs to our partners around the country to help with the overpopulation in Texas. Our mission is to save every precious life possible.
